verses.verse: In that day<WH3117> shall this song<WH7892> be sung<WH7891> in the land<WH776> of Judah<WH3063>; We have a strong<WH5797> city<WH5892>; salvation<WH3444> will God appoint<WH7896> for walls<WH2346> and bulwarks<WH2426>.
Open<WH6605> the gates<WH8179>, that the righteous<WH6662> nation<WH1471> which keeps<WH8104> the truth<WH529> may enter in<WH935>.
You will keep<WH5341> him in perfect<WH7965> peace<WH7965>, whose mind<WH3336> is stayed<WH5564> on you<WH982>: because he trusts in you.
Trust<WH982> in the Lord<WH3068> for ever<WH5703>: for in the Lord<WH3050> Jehovah<WH3068> is everlasting<WH5769> strength<WH6697>:

For he brings down<WH7817> them that live<WH3427> on high<WH4791>; the lofty<WH7682> city<WH7151>, he lays it low<WH8213>; he lays it low<WH8213>, even to the ground<WH776>; he brings<WH5060> it even to the dust<WH6083>.
The foot<WH7272> shall tread it down<WH7429>, even the feet<WH7272> of the poor<WH6041>, and the steps<WH6471> of the needy<WH1800>.
The way<WH734> of the just<WH6662> is uprightness<WH4339>: you<WH3477>, most upright, do weigh<WH6424> the path<WH4570> of the just<WH6662>.
Yes<WH734>, in the way of your judgments<WH4941>, O Lord<WH3068>, have we waited<WH6960> for you<WH8378>; the desire of our soul<WH5315> is to your name<WH8034>, and to the memory of you<WH2143>.

With my soul<WH5315> have I desired<WH183> you in the night<WH3915>; Yes<WH7307>, with my spirit inside<WH7130> me will I seek you early<WH7836>: for when your judgments<WH4941> are in the earth<WH776>, the inhabitants<WH3427> of the world<WH8398> will learn<WH3925> righteousness<WH6664>.

Let favor be shown<WH2603> to the wicked<WH7563>, yet will he not<WH1077> learn<WH3925> righteousness<WH6664>: in the land<WH776> of uprightness<WH5229> will he deal unjustly<WH5765>, and will not<WH1077> behold<WH7200> the majesty<WH1348> of the Lord<WH3068>.

Lord<WH3068>, when your hand<WH3027> is lifted up<WH7311>, they will not see<WH2372>: but they shall see<WH2372>, and be ashamed<WH954> for their envy<WH7068> at the people<WH5971>; Yes<WH784>, the fire of your enemies<WH6862> shall devour them<WH398>.
Lord<WH3068>, you will ordain<WH8239> peace<WH7965> for us<WH6466>: for you also have done all our works in us<WH4639>.
O Lord<WH3068> our God<WH430>, other lords<WH113> beside<WH2108> you have had dominion<WH1166> over us<WH2142>: but by you only will we make mention of your name<WH8034>.

They are dead<WH4191>, they shall not live<WH2421>; they are deceased<WH7496>, they shall not rise<WH6965>: therefore have you visited<WH6485> and destroyed<WH8045> them<WH2143>, and made all their memory to perish<WH6>.

You have increased<WH3254> the nation<WH1471>, O Lord<WH3068>, you have increased<WH3254> the nation<WH1471>: you are glorified<WH3513>: you had removed it far<WH7368> unto all the ends<WH7099> of the earth<WH776>.
Lord<WH3068>, in trouble<WH6862> have they visited<WH6485> you<WH6694>, they poured out a prayer<WH3908> when your chastening was upon them<WH4148>.

Like<WH3644> as a woman with child<WH2030>, that draws near<WH7126> the time of her delivery<WH3205>, is in pain<WH2342>, and cries out<WH2199> in her pangs<WH2256>; so have we been in your sight<WH6440>, O Lord<WH3068>.

We have been with child<WH2029>, we have been in pain<WH2342>, we have as it were<WH3644> brought forth<WH3205> wind<WH7307>; we have not done<WH6213> any deliverance<WH3444> in the earth<WH776>; neither<WH1077> have the inhabitants<WH3427> of the world<WH8398> fallen<WH5307>.

Your dead<WH4191> men shall live<WH2421>, together with my dead body<WH5038> shall they arise<WH6965>. Awake<WH6974> and sing<WH7442>, you that live<WH7931> in dust<WH6083>: for your dew<WH2919> is as the dew<WH2919> of herbs<WH219>, and the earth<WH776> shall cast out<WH5307> the dead<WH7496>.

Come<WH3212>, my people<WH5971>, enter<WH935> into your chambers<WH2315>, and shut<WH5462> your doors<WH1817> about you<WH2247>: hide yourself as it were for a little<WH4592> moment<WH7281>, until the indignation<WH2195> be overpast<WH5674>.

For<WH3068>, behold, the Lord comes out<WH3318> of his place<WH4725> to punish<WH6485> the inhabitants<WH3427> of the earth<WH776> for their iniquity<WH5771>: the earth<WH776> also shall disclose<WH1540> her blood<WH1818>, and shall no more cover<WH3680> her slain<WH2026>.
